title: Hoisin and Sriracha Chicken Wings
directions: In a mixing bowl mix together the hoisin sauce, sriracha sauce, grated ginger and the sesame oil.
Toss the chicken wings in the mixture and marinate for 2 to 3 hours or overnight. I usually place this in a ziplock bag and set aside.
Pre-heat the oven to 375 degrees and place the wings in a casserole and bake for 20 minutes, until soft and sticky.
Remove from the oven place in a serving dish and toss with the scallions and sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve.
